revised_title: Photosensitised Explosion of Hydrogen and Oxygen by Chlorine: Kinetics and Temperature Effects
tldr: This study investigates the photosensitised explosion of hydrogen and oxygen by chlorine, focusing on the kinetics and temperature effects. The authors found that the limiting pressure of chlorine fits an equation related to thermal explosive reactions, but the agreement is considered fortuitous due to the photochemical nature of the hydrogen-chlorine reaction.
